creator.name: Directie van Berbice
creator.his_func:
The Board of Berbice, a joint stock company in Amsterdam since 1714, was independent of the West India Company (WIC), except for the supply of slaves. The Board of seven directors was responsible for the administration and defence of Berbice. It proposed candidates for a governor on the spot, who received his commission from the States-General.

The great slave uprising of 1763-1764 brought the Board into serious (financial) problems. At the end of 1795 the colony came under the control of the States-General; the Board turned into the Committee for the Affairs of the Colonies and Possessions on the Guinea Coast and in America, abbreviated to the 'West India Committee'.

The stock company was disbanded in 1848, following the settlement of all financial requirements.
